page.title: 02ARCHITECTURE IN BIGGLESWADE
page.content: In the town centre the Market House, now a restaurant, and the White Hart public house are both Tudor buildings, although much restored. The Crown public house is mid-Georgian, while St. Andrew's Church is mainly in the Perpendicular style, with a grandly vaulted south porch. The former mill on the river Ivel has now been con- verted into residential flats. Most other housing was built during the 20th century, with a substantial amount dating from well before the 1939-45 world war. There are now many large modern private housing estates, together with some 12-1300 council houses.
